intro: Agave × leopoldii, commonly known as the blue agave, is a hybrid plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is characterized by its rosette-shaped growth pattern and thick, succulent leaves that are typically blue-green in color. The plant produces a tall flowering stalk that can reach several meters in height, bearing small, white flowers. It is drought-tolerant and thrives in well-drained soils, making it well-suited for arid environments. Due to its unique appearance and hardy nature, it is often cultivated as an ornamental plant.
